title: [Large-Scale] Workshop on Designing Social Studies Virtual Learning Environments (VLEs) Using a Constructivist Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic experience with online learning platforms and understanding of core social studies concepts (citizenship, culture, history, geography)
context.additional_context: VLE (Virtual Learning Environment) design competency development for social studies educators, focusing on digital citizenship and cultural understanding for practical classroom application.

learning_goals: Learners explain ≥3 design principles for social studies VLE content reflecting constructivist learning theory (historical context integration, cultural diversity reflection, civic competency enhancement).

Learners develop 5 interactive activities using imaginative education techniques to improve learners’ social relationship understanding (e.g., role-play simulations, virtual social problem-solving projects).

Learners select blended media resources for social studies corresponding to diverse learning styles (visual/auditory/kinesthetic) (e.g., historical maps, oral testimony videos, virtual field experiences).
Learners propose ≥2 online discussion strategies promoting collaborative learning (e.g., social issue debates, virtual citizen council operations).

resources: Interactive Tools Trial Versions (Padlet, Mentimeter, etc.)
Case Analysis VLE (Virtual Learning Environment) Pilot Site

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
